text: The day Corey Feldman met Corey Haim, when they were 14 years old and preparing to work together on the film “ The Lost Boys, ” they bonded instantly. Both were young Jewish actors who often competed for the same roles. They shared a first name and even a favorite number, sort of. Haim ’ s was 222. Feldman ’ s was 22. As they spoke, it became clear that they also shared horrific histories of abuse. Haim confided in his new friend that on the set of the 1986 film “ Lucas, ” “ an adult male convinced him that it was perfectly normal for older men and younger boys in the business to have sexual relations, that it was what all the guys do.
